Image.Text: I am the Double Bond! I am the second sibling of the famous Bond Brothers! Would you know much about me?
No!? You should read Chemical Times more often. Listen up, a covalent bond is when two atoms share pairs of electrons. As a Double Bond, 2 pairs of electron pairs are shared. [row] Want to know more?

Alkenes for instance, are classified as 'Alkenes' by having a Alkenyl functional group, namely a Double Bond between two Carbon atoms. This is why there isn't a 'Methene'! There needs to be at least two in a relationship.
Alright, be on your way then.
Here, have my autograph and you can be on your way.
